result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendall J Avery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 14CF189 & 14CM213 called together at 4:05 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kendall J Avery in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes repeater enhancer on each case - Count #1

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-14CF189 & 14CM213; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

On Count #1-14CF189, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 3 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to be served in the prison system; to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $268 + $250 DNA Surcharge = $518; to be reduced to a civil judgment
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $756, payable to Wal-Mart Inc. + 10 % restitution processing fee (if applicable), to be reduced to civil judgment
--Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP

Felony Firearm/Voting Restrictions Warnings Given

On Count #1-14CM213, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 3 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to be served in the prison system; to commence consecutive to 14CF189
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443; to be reduced to civil judgment
--Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP
Recess: 4:24 pm

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 3, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Cases 14CF189 & 14CM213 called together at 9:29 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kendall J Avery appears in custody, via video with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight & sound sufficient
Atty Svehlek: Have proposed resolution on a free to argue basis. Requests matter be set for change of plea/sentencing in 2 weeks, presents basis
ADA Teuber: No objection
Court directs State to prepare writ
Recess: 9:31 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule for Plea/Sentencing in 2 weeks - Send notices
of the 8/26/14 Sentencing After Revocation Hearing/Status Conference held before the Honorable Judge Jennifer L. Weston (transcript held in 14CF189)
State's (with cover letter)
Status conference on October 21, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 24, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Cases 13CF323, 14CF189 & 14CM213 called together at 11:06 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kendall J Avery in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF189 & 14CM213: Do not have agreement on these files yet, requests additional STC.
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Svehlek requests the court set STC date depending on outcome of revocation hearing

13CF323: Sentencing arguments by Counsel

On Counts #2, the Court sentences Mr. Avery to 2.5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  6 months, each count, concurrent. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being & concurrent to Count #3

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
-not to possess or consume any alcohol
-no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores, except for employment purposes
-obtain employment or education program as approved by agent
-No contact with minors under the age of 16 except his own biological children
-Not be required to comply with sex offender rules of probation as it pertains to contact with minors until such time that Department obtains evidence that Mr. Avery poses a risk to minors
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent

On Count #3, the Court sentences Mr. Avery to
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence concurrent to Count #2, to be served in prison system

236 days credit for time already served given
All costs and fees to be reduced to civil judgment

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Court advises Atty Svehlek to notify the Court and State if case will be plea, wo writ can be prepared
Recess: 11:58 am 

NEXT: 14CF189 & 14CM213: (1) Schedule DA PTC 9/24/14 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 2-3 weeks after DA PTC - Send notices *via video*
Status conference on August 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.
[MK]

cases #14CF189 and #14CM213 called at 8:37am.
Defendant Kendall J Avery in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

In case #14CF189:  Mr. Avery waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
In case #14CF189: Arraignment is held: service of Information admitted, reading waived, the Count #1 charge and maximum penalties are recited; a plea of "not guilty" is entered.
Attorney Svehlek requests that the cases be scheduled for Status/ possible Plea & Sentencing. 
recess 8:40am.
 
NEXT:  schedule both cases for Status Conference (possible plea/sentencing) on 8/26/14 at 11:00am  (Attorney Svehlek indicated that Sentencing After Revocation is anticipated in one of Mr. Avery's completed cases, so if possible, schedule the SEHR on the same date and time)
Preliminary hearing on August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 30, 2014 at 09:40 am.
TO COVER CASES 14CF189 & 14CM213

Cases 14CF189 & 14CM213 called together at 3:22 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kendall J Avery in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

BOTH CASES: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
14CF189: Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
14CM213: Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, to cover both cases, with conditions:
-No direct or indirect contact with Briana Krueger except through a 3rd person for purposes of child placement arrangements or communications regarding the child
-No direct or indirect contact with Theresa Nyakirangani
-No presence at the Wal-Mart Store, Watertown

NEXT:  BOTH CASES: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 7/30/14 at 9:40 am - Send notices 
(2) Schedule Preliminary Hearing (14CF189) & STC (14CM213) 2-3 weeks after DA PTC on the same date/time - Send notices
